alert.note: Alert for Burke (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 10:47AM EDT until May 28 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Burke County in western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams including farmland, nurseries, boat-access ramps, and secondary roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1043 AM EDT, The Johns River is expected to linger above Action/Advisory Stage through the afternoon, causing nuisance flooding from Adako to Chesterfield. The river level is currently at 11.2 feet and cresting, and the level should continue to slowly fall today, gradually receding below the Action/Advisory Stage by this evening. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
